Plot bar plots for protein abundance or fold change

Source: R/proteomics_plots.R
prot.plot_bar.Rd

This function generates bar plots for protein abundance or fold change, normalized by either a reference protein or centered to the mean. The user can also plot the contrast of two conditions.

Usage

prot.plot_bar(
  dep,
  proteins,
  combine = FALSE,
  ref.prot = NULL,
  type = c("contrast", "centered", "reference", "abundance"),
  contrast = NULL,
  col.id = "ID",
  name_table = NULL,
  match.id = "Accession",
  match.name = "Name",
  convert_name = FALSE,
  shape.size = 2.5,
  y.lim = NULL,
  plot = TRUE,
  export = TRUE,
  export.nm = NULL,
  width = NULL,
  height = NULL
)

Arguments

dep

A SummarizedExperiment object containing the data.

proteins

A vector of protein names or IDs.

combine

Logical value indicating whether to combine the data from different proteins in one plot.

ref.prot

ID or name of the reference protein for normalization when type is "reference".

type

Type of plot: "abundance", "reference", "centered" or "contrast".

contrast

Name of the contrast for plotting when type is "contrast".

col.id

Name of the column with protein IDs in dep.

name_table

A data frame containing the mapping of protein names to reference names.

match.id

The name of a column in name_table to find matches with col.id.

match.name

The name of a column in name_table to assign new names based on matches of col.id and match.id.

convert_name

Logical value indicating whether to convert the protein names to reference names based on name_table (e.g., gene names).

shape.size

Numeric value defining the (replicate) symbol size in the plot

y.lim

Limits of the y axis.

plot

wether to return the plot or not.

export

Logical; whether to export the plot as PDF an PNG files

export.nm

Name of the output PDF and PNG files if export = TRUE.

width

Numeric value defining the width of the exported plot.

height

Numeric value defining the height of the exported plot.

Value

A ggplot object as well as (invisibly) a dataframe with the data used for creating the plot.
